title: 105_hr120
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997" defines key terms. Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include changes related to family farms, paragraph designations, security interests, and liens. The amendments to Section 101 of title 11, United States Code include changes to paragraph designations, security interests, and liens. This involves renumbering paragraphs and making adjustments to punctuation. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Amends Section 104 of title 11, United States Code by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. 

SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Amends Section 108(c)(2) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``922'' and all that follows through ``or'', and inserting ``922, 1201, or''. 

SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR PERSONS WHO NEGLIGENTLY OR FRAUDULENTLY PREPARE BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Amends Section 110(j)(3) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``attorney's'' and inserting ``attorneys' ''. 

SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Section 327 of title 11, United States Code is amended to update the authority of the Trustee, including changes in subsections (b), (c), and (d). Section 328(b) is also amended to limit compensation by removing the ability to serve as an attorney or accountant. Section 328(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to limit compensation by changing the language regarding professional services, removing references to serving as an attorney or accountant. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 328(a) of title 11, United States Code to include compensation on a fixed or percentage fee basis.

SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code to adjust compensation for officers and attorneys.

SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code by removing certain tax provisions.

SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code is amended by removing certain tax provisions. SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code is amended to include "of the estate" after "property" the first time it appears. SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. Section 362 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions regarding security interests and entities. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions related to the satisfaction of penalty rates and nonmonetary obligations in executory contracts and unexpired leases. The amendments to Section 365 of title 11, United States Code include provisions regarding the satisfaction of penalty rates and nonmonetary obligations in executory contracts and unexpired leases. This includes changes such as adding "or" at the end of paragraph (2) in subsection (c), striking paragraphs (5) through (9) in subsection (d), and revising subsection (f)(1) by removing text after a certain point and inserting a period. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS.

Amends the item for section 556 related to contractual rights for commodities contracts or forward contracts.

SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

Amends section 503(b)(4) of title 11, inserting references to subparagraphs before paragraph (3).

SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. Amends section 503(b)(4) of title 11 by inserting references to subparagraphs before paragraph (3). SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. Amends section 507(a) by adjusting punctuation and adding "unsecured" after "allowed." SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. Amends Section 522 of title 11, United States Code, by clarifying liabilities and subsection references. SEC. 16. EXCEPTIONS TO DISCHARGE. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new subsections related to exemptions and exceptions to discharge in bankruptcy cases. In subsection (a), amendments include provisions for spouses, former spouses, and children of the debtor. Subsection (a)(17) specifies actions on prisoners by Federal courts. Subsection (e) corrects a typographical error. SEC. 17 amends Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, United States Code. SEC. 18 modifies Section 525(c) regarding protection against discriminatory treatment. SEC. 19 addresses property of the estate. SEC. 19 amends Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, inserting "365 or" before "542". SEC. 20 redesignates subsection (g) as subsection (h) in Section 546. SEC. 21 deals with the liability of transferee of avoided transfer. Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code is amended to clarify the recovery process for transfers that are avoidable under section 547. The amendment specifies the conditions under which a transfer can be avoided or recovered from a transferee who was not an insider at the time of the transfer. Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code is amended to clarify the recovery process for transfers that are avoidable under section 547, specifying conditions for avoiding or recovering transfers from non-insider transferees. SEC. 22. SETOFF. Amends section 553(b)(1) of title 11, United States Code by changing "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)". SEC. 23. DISPOSITION OF PROPERTY OF THE ESTATE. Amends section 726(b) of title 11, United States Code by removing "1009,". SEC. 24. GENERAL PROVISIONS. Amends section 901(a) of title 11, United States Code by adding "1123(d)," after "1123(b),". SEC. 25. APPOINTMENT OF ELECTED TRUSTEE. Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions for the election of an eligible, disinterested trustee at a meeting of creditors. Upon certification by the United States trustee, the elected trustee will be considered appointed, and the service of any trustee appointed under subsection (d) will terminate. The trustee elected under paragraph (1) is considered selected and appointed for this section, terminating the service of any trustee appointed under subsection (d). Disputes regarding the election will be resolved by the court. SEC. 26-29 of title 11, United States Code, are amended to update references and provisions related to railroad line abandonment, plan contents, payments, and discharge. SEC. 29 amends section 1228 of title 11 by updating references. SEC. 30 amends section 1322 by adjusting subsections. SEC. 31 addresses discharge. SEC. 31 amends section 1328(a) of title 11, United States Code, regarding discharge by specifying exceptions for certain debts, including those under section 1322(b)(5), specified in section 523(a)(5), (8), or (9), and for restitution or criminal fines related to a debtor's conviction. SEC. 32 amends Section 1334(d) of title 28, US Code, by clarifying references to subsections. SEC. 33 modifies Section 604 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 by renumbering subsections. SEC. 34 addresses knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 34 amends Section 156(a) of title 18, US Code by defining terms related to bankruptcy law and documents. SEC. 35 states that the Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
